intro: Tetrastigma pilosum, commonly known as the hairy raisin vine, is a climbing plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Vitaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by bright red, fleshy berries. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for horticultural study and potential ornamental use.
